column1: #Text=Saturday , September 8 , 2007
#Text=On Sunday
#Text=Memoirs : 1939-1993
#Text=a memoir written by former Prime Minister of Canada Brian Mulroney will be released .
#Text=The 1,152 page tome outlines Mulroney 's version of events during his time as prime minister .
#Text=CTV will broadcast a documentary on Brian Mulroney on the eve of his book launch .
#Text=In addition , the network plans to air Triumph & Treachery : The Brian Mulroney Story
#Text=on Sunday , CTV says the 90-minute special will be the most complete interview the former prime minister has ever given and his first comprehensive interview since leaving office in 1993 .
#Text=The Quebec French language TVA network will air a similar documentary exclusively in French later that night .
#Text=Mulroney allocates a fair amount of text commenting on his antogonist the late and former Prime Minister Pierre Elliot Trudeau .
#Text=Mulroney believes that Trudeau lacked the moral fibre to be Prime Minister for not serving in the Canadian Forces during World War II .
#Text=“ Pierre Trudeau was not among them .
#Text=That 's a decision he made .
#Text=He 's entitled to make that kind of decision .
#Text=But it does n't qualify him for any position of moral leadership in our society . ” — Mulroney

#Text=Mulroney insinuates that the young Trudeau had anti-Semitic beliefs at that time , " This is a man who questioned the Allies when the Jews were being sacrificed and when the great extermination program was on , he was marching around Outremont , Quebec on the other side of the issue . "
#Text=Mulroney also blames Trudeau for scuttling the Meech Lake Accord , the 1990 pact aimed at securing Quebec 's signature on the Constitution of Canada .
#Text=The current Prime Minister Stephen Harper supported Mulroney 's right to comment on Trudeau , " I think it 's well known Mr. Mulroney was an opponent of Mr. Trudeau , " Harper said .
#Text=" He was his opposition leader and , as you know , came to power at the end of the Trudeau period when people wanted to make a change .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Trudeau 's former piers and friends have rallied behind his legacy and made public comments to dampen Mulroney 's accusations .

#Text=Stephane Dion responded to Mulroney critiques with a five paragraph statement posted on the Liberal Party website ,  It is regrettable that , after attending prime minister Trudeau ’s state funeral and praising him as ' an exceptional individual who served his country effectively and well … a gallant political warrior who loved his country , ' Mr. Mulroney would seem to be at such odds with his own views . "

column1: #Text=Tom Axworthy 's , response to Mulroney was that Trudeau should be judged by his actions once his values matured and he entered public life , not by " ridiculous " thoughts he entertained briefly in his teens and early twenties .

#Text=John R. English stated , Trudeau 's youthful views must be put in the context of the times , when most Quebecers were so virulently anti-British and opposed to what they saw as a British war that they were blinded to the evils of Hitler 's Nazism .
